ground_truth: Slughorn sits on a chair, looking anxious. At last, Ron comes round, sits up, then lies back weakly on the floor. In the infirmary, Ginny and Hermione sit beside Ron's bed as Madam Pomfrey checks his temperature. Harry turns as a group of staff come in, and Lavender rushes in. She sees Hermione at Ron's bedside and leans closer before running out as Hermione takes Ron's hand. McGonagall, Dumbledore, and Snape leave, followed by Ginny turning to Harry and Madame Pomfrey leaving. Hermione catches Harry's eye, and they exchange a smile. Harry is the last to leave the ward. Sitting on Ron's bed, Hermione strengthens her grip on his hand with a sigh of contentment. The shadow of a figure climbing stairs is cast on a wall. Going up the spiral staircase, Harry spots the figure through an archway: it's Draco Malfoy. Harry steps forward, watches him, and then follows. Draco leaves the upper corridor where the birdcage hangs, now with only one bird remaining. Draco stands still and closes his eyes. When Harry rounds the corner, Draco has disappeared. In the cluttered room, Draco holds the heavy cloth from the cabinet, holding the missing bird. He closes the bird inside the cabinet, picks a single feather off his cuff, and holds it up to the light. Draco opens the cabinet: the bird has gone. Rain pours down on the Borgin and Burke shop sign. Through the dusty arched window at the rear of the shop, a dim light reveals the triangular cabinet, its door firmly closed. Draco nervously opens his cabinet door, looks inside, and finds the bird dead. Draco stares at its lifeless body and frowns, then sobs. Lavender sits in the Great Hall glaring at Ron. Clenching his wand, he sits beside Hermione, as snowflakes start to fall. Ron looks puzzled. Ron, Hermione, and Harry look across at Lavender, who lifts her chin and grits her teeth. Harry's eyes flit from Ron to Hermione and back again, while Hermione looks down. Harry reads a note scrawled in his advanced potion book, jumps to his feet, picks up his book, then marches up the hall to Katie. She looks over his shoulder and stares. Harry turns and sees Draco watching them. Draco backs away, turns, and Harry's out. Katie walks away with her friend as Harry marches down the Great Hall. Draco makes his way upstairs. Harry pushes his way through a group of students as Draco strides along the upstairs corridor where the birdcage is now empty. Harry isn't far behind. Loosening his tie, Draco rushes into the boy’s lavatories, leans over a basin, then pulls off his sweater. Turning on a tap, he studies his distraught face in a mirror.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Snufflefoot lounges on a hammock, feeling jubilant. Finally, Steve leaps over, stands up, then collapses lightly on the ceiling. In the gallery, Megan and Barbara float beneath Steve's hammock as Sir Wilson measures his patience. Larry spins as a pack of sailors sails in, and Matilda charges in. She notices Barbara at Steve's headrest and drifts nearer before gliding away as Barbara grasps Steve's foot. Mabunda, Eisenhower, and Smith depart, trailed by Megan flicking an eyebrow at Larry and Sir Wilson drifting away. Barbara catches Larry's frown, and they share a grin. Larry is the first to arrive at the paddock. Perched on Steve's elbow, Barbara loosens her grip on his elbow with a sigh of relief. The light of a chimera leaping roofs is cast on a cloud. Floating down the circular trunk, Larry glimpses the chimera through a tunnel: it's Luigi Ricardo. Larry hops backward, observes him, and then trails. Luigi exits the lower passage where the aquarium floats, now with only one fish remaining. Luigi stands moving and shuts his mouth. When Larry rounds the edge, Luigi has appeared. In the organized space, Luigi balances the light fabric from the dresser, balancing the existing fish. He opens the fish inside the dresser, selects a single scale off his hat, and balances it down to the dark. Luigi closes the dresser: the fish has appeared. Sunlight bursts up on the Fitz and Furley boat banner. Through the misty circular port at the front of the boat, a bright sound hides the rectangular dresser, its lid slightly ajar. Luigi confidently closes his dresser lid, gazes outward, and loses the fish alive. Luigi grins at its vibrant scales and cheers, then laughs. Matilda floats in the Large House smiling at Steve. Cradling his hat, he floats beside Barbara, as rainbows begin to splash. Steve smiles delighted. Steve, Barbara, and Larry beam across at Matilda, who drops her mouth and relaxes her arms. Larry's ears bounce from Steve to Barbara and across again, while Barbara stares high. Larry writes a song inscribed in his simple map hat, floats onto his hands, places down his hat, then twirls down the room to Martha. She gazes under his eyelid and beams. Larry spins and hears Luigi hiding from them. Luigi steps forward, spins, and Larry's in. Martha drifts forward with her parrot as Larry twirls up the Small House. Luigi drifts his path downward. Larry pulls his way out of a crowd of teachers as Luigi dances along the downstairs hallway where the aquarium is now packed. Larry is close ahead. Tightening his shoes, Luigi saunters out of the children’s cathedral, floats under a fountain, then tugs on his vest. Dimming on a light, he examines his joyful hair in a wall.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

Lavender rushes in, sees Hermione comforting Ron, and leaves upset. McGonagall, Dumbledore, Snape, and others exit, leaving Hermione and Harry alone to share a smile. Hermione stays with Ron, content. Meanwhile, Harry follows Draco up a staircase. Draco stands in a corridor with one remaining bird in a cage and later disappears. In a cluttered room, Draco places the bird in a cabinet, but it vanishes. At Borgin and Burke's, Draco finds the bird dead and sobs. Back in the Great Hall, tension arises as Lavender glares at Ron who sits with Hermione. Harry observes the dynamics and acts on a note from his potion book, confronting Katie who notices Draco watching them. Draco retreats as Harry confronts him. In the boy's lavatories, Draco removes his sweater and looks at his distraught reflection, indicating his internal struggle.
